Beginners Tip (for Software Developers):

Work in startups in the initial few years of your career. Your learnings and growth are steep compared to in MNCs. 

MNCs may add value to your resume, but startups will accelerate your learnings & your career!

Tip #1 for DBA - Before changing any parameter always backup spfile Reasons: 1-if you have startup error you can startup from the pfile 2- any error you can check original value in pfile SQL>create pfile from spfile #oracledatabase #basics

As a founder if you are sharing with investors your spreadsheet that models your business please make sure that it is commented with notes. Make it easy for the person looking at your model to understand it. It will help you too as you work though it. #startup #tips

032521:

Pro Tips:
- If you don't agree w/ a team member, write / meet them privately. 
- If a team member is rude to you, they are unhappy. 
- Never share startup finances with everyone on your team.
- Do NOT announce customers and sales until the contract is signed.

#Business #Tip : When building your team, value a person’s ability to learn quickly, adapt and grow, over their experience. There are too many unknowns in a startup so agility and being able to adjust course quickly is often times what’s required.

Bonus tip: If you build it, they will *not* come. (Sorry, Kevin Costner 😊 ⚾️)
You must spend time marketing what you create. Building is not enough. Don't assume word-of-mouth will happen, no matter how good your solution is.

General tip:

If you get offered stock options at a startup without being told up-front how many options are outstanding and any expected dilution events, kick the person making the offer in the dick, and delete them as a contact. They just tried to buy you with Monopoly money.

My no. 1 tip for small businesses and entrepreneurs (not tech startups)

Don’t chase wild profits or growth from day one, focus on unit economics.

De-risk yourself as much as possible, avoid losses at all costs and the gains will take care of themselves. 

Go slowly but surely.
Tips for: Managing a startup’s cash burn rate during a pandemic and positioning yourself to take advantage of luck when it comes. #entrepreneur #healthcare

Just some start up tips:
- in the startup screen, disable the joystick
- the game by default runs too fast. use ctrl + F11 to slow the game down
- arrow keys for movement, j for jump, space for fire, esc for weapon screen, enter for selection in stage select

@tip_nz But those are not comparable. The competition in startups leads to new complex entities, business.

The competition for mining leads to better GPUs at best. Or just throwing more energy at the problem.

@strayserval My tip is to try and get an ergonomically rated ex-office chair. If you're lucky you can get stuff bought for things like startups super cheap resold wholesale.

Assuming you're not attached to the aesthetics of it.

@evanderkoogh Competition is a great thing. The innovation and efficiency gains as a result of competition outweigh the cost in my opinion. Do you think your startup is wasted energy even though there are competitors?

#Business #Tip : One of the most important character traits you should develop as a startup CEO is resilience. You will face many challenges, often daily, and you will question everything. This is normal. Keep reminding yourself why you started your business. You will get there.

Tip for anyone applying/interviewing for a startup 💡

The speed at which you respond to emails is 💯 a factor in you getting hired.

At a startup, often all we really have is our speed and we need to know that new employees won't slow things down 🚀

The grim story is this: there are no shortcuts. Join a startup community, for free, with likeminded founders. Exchange contacts and tips. Keep your meager cash tight to your chest. Then just get your head down!

My no#1 early stage founder tip: 

Your startup is dead by default (to people who have millions of things going in their lives) 

It is your job daily to resurrect it & make it worth remembering by telling stories, building in public, offering value etc

Freelance Designer Rate Tip 09:

Freelancing to startups is a great way to gain experience doing a TON of things. Also, you’ll probably be 1099 and can supply your own terms, so feel free to craft something that works well for you and don’t be afraid to negotiate a bit.

Make every detail perfect and limit the number of details to perfect

When applying for jobs in startups
- message founders first
- if they don't reply connect with the employees for a referral
- at last, apply in job portals

By applying directly to the founder you save their referral and can get paid higher as the total budget is fixed!
